definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: Friendships provide a sense of belonging and comfort.
sentences.chinese: 友誼提供了歸屬感和舒適感。

sentences.english: We all want to belong, no matter what our age.
sentences.chinese: 無論我們年齡有多大，我們需要歸屬感。

sentences.english: In conclusion, friendships provide a sense of belonging and comfort.
sentences.chinese: 最後，友誼提供了歸屬感和舒適感。

sentences.english: They used to be floating in the air and at last found their own sense of belongingness .
sentences.chinese: 他們從漂浮於空中到最終尋找到自己的一種歸屬感。

sentences.english: Just after the attacks, there was a sentiment of togetherness that ran through the city.
sentences.chinese: 襲擊發生以後，這座城市中瀰漫着一種歸屬感。

sentences.english: The 120-page quarterly, which is available online, gives Zhou "a sense of belonging", she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說120頁的在線季刊，給了她“歸屬感”。

sentences.english: In general, I have a good sense of community on the on-line brand community.
sentences.chinese: 總的來說，我對虛擬品牌社區有良好的歸屬感。

sentences.english: One of the most fundamental human needs is the need to belong.
sentences.chinese: 人們最基本的需求之一那便是歸屬感。

definition: the characteristics and circumstances particular to a country/current state of a country
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
partner (in four person game)/family of proposed marriage partner
